definition[0]: to go to the door with someone to say goodbye to them when they leave
example[1]: Don’t worry, I can see myself out (=leave the building without anyone coming with me).
definition[1]: to continue doing something or being somewhere until a particular period of time or an unpleasant event is finished
example[2]: Connolly has promised to see out the remaining 18 months of his contract.
example[3]: She saw out her last years at Sudeley Castle.
